DOC.brief_summary: RCT evaluate safety efficacy Lactobacillus reuteri DSM 16666 & Lactobacillus reuteri DSM 17938 significantly modify frequency clinical bacteriological cure woman non complicate acute cystitis receive probiotic 12 day compare frequency woman receive placebo .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Trial L. Reuteri Urinary Tract Infections Non Pregnant Women
DOC.detailed_description: Randomized , double blind , placebo control , pilot trial evaluate safety efficacy L. reuteri non menopausal woman non complicate cystitis term frequency clinical bacteriological cure . Secondary outcome ) time clinical/laboratory relapse least 70 % woman non complicate acute cystitis receive probiotic 12 day compare time woman receive placebo ; b ) frequency clinical/laboratory bacteriologic relapse woman non complicate acute cystitis receive probiotic 12 day compare frequency woman receive placebo , day 30 treatment start c ) frequency adverse related event woman non complicate acute cystitis receive probiotic 12 day compare frequency woman receive placebo . In active product use 5*10^8 CFU Lactobacillus reuteri DSM 16666 & Lactobacillus reuteri DSM 17938 + cranberry extract . The control group recibe Cranberry extract . The product take twice per day , morning evening .
DOC.criteria: Non pregnant pre menopausal woman Minimum age 18 year Uncomplicated cystitis diagnose urine dipstick testing ( nitrate + , leukocytes esterase and/or 105 CFU/ml nitrate + , leukocytes esterase + and/or 102 103 CFU/ml+ clinical symptom ) evaluation presence typical relate symptom . In particular , frequency ( frequent void urine ) , urgency ( urge void immediately ) , dysuria ( painful voiding ) , and/or suprapubic pain . Verbal Written Informed Consent participation study Acute cystitis symptom > 1week first visit Diabetes mellitus , Congenital urinary tract abnormality Lactating woman Female intend become pregnant study within 3 month completion study Vaginal discharge + fever ( > 37.5oC ) Diagnostic sexually transmit disease Use indwell catheter intermittent selfcatheterisation program Presence neurogenic bladder , Use antibiotic 2 week Day 1 study .
